intro: Eusteralis salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaved eusteralis, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is notable for its lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of willow trees, hence its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. Eusteralis salicifolia is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
